Reviews.Title: “Human not supposed to stay in this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Me S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is full of dust, my whole family getting sick so we have to move to another hotel in the middle of the night. when we check-in the previous day, the bed and the carpet seems like never cleaned. This hotel is for one night stand, very poor quality. The TV doesn't have remote, the closet missing a door. I warned you save your money and stay in Ramada. $20 more expensive but it's totally better environment!

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: kevin r
Reviews.Content: Very good for price and has the best location there. All inns were 180 this was just 80 and it was right by centruy city and all the major attractions. All the hotels were nearly doubled or tripled. AMAZING

Reviews.Title: “LOVED”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte143
Reviews.Content: I visited L.A from Ohio with a couple of my friends. My friends decided to stay in a hotel near Century City. I personally did not want to pay $180 per night, and so I checked in Stars Inn Motel. Thank goodness I found this motel because not only was this at an AMAZING location, but the prices were more than half of what my friends were paying. Stars Inn is one of those secret gems that you only tell your close friends about, and I am definitely planning on staying on my next visit. The only problem I found, is due to its popularity, I couldn't find a parking spot, but the manager was nice enough to give me his parking spot. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND STARS INN.

Reviews.Title: “best value for price -clean & newly remodeled”
Reviews.Author: buspro
Reviews.Content: At first I was very worried to stay at this motel because of the online review .But I found this place very clean & apparently recently remodeled . The lady at the office was very polite & helpful. Since I did not have a car it was very convenient for me to walk to the shops & movie theaters & lots of restaurant across the street at the mall.

Reviews.Title: “Filthiest dump I've ever seen.”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvl1950
Reviews.Content: I was promised the rooms weren't as bad as online reviews said, but they were worse. When I complained about the mold and filth they raised the price and then said I couldn't stay there. Bathroom was full of mold and the floor was rotting. Motel 6 looks like a palace in comparison.

Reviews.Title: “FILTHY RUN DOWN HORROR SHOW. LIKE A BAD HOSTEL.”
Reviews.Author: aluminimfredo
Reviews.Content: I Should Have Known it was going to be bad when the guy working in the office tried to short change me on my change. He said it was a mistake, but I don't think so. The first room he gave me was in the back. I wish I had taken a picture of it. I thought it was a joke. Absolutely filthy, broken lamp, an old small 12 inch T.V., and I won't even get started on the bathroom. I asked for a new room, and he gave me a different one. Not much better. So I explained the problems, and explained it might be better if I just get my money back. Then his boss came out, and was pretty rude. I explained that I stayed here several years ago for a couple weeks, and it was a great hotel then. He acted like I was lying. He then offered me one last room, and since it was better than the first 2, and it was getting later in the evening, I took it. I didn't see any bugs, but it had such an unclean feeling that I slept on top of the sheets, and I checked out at the first sight of morning. Really awful!!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty bad but cheap”
Reviews.Author: semprinvacanza
Reviews.Content: let's make it short: + location near Beverly Hills; cheap. - not very clean; receptionist unfriendly; rooms worn out. you choose :-)

Reviews.Title: “The worst ever Really bad !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: phototravelerchico
Reviews.Content: Room #1 should be condemned .. torn down .. Carpet was stinky filthy, ripped, worn out. Bed had long black hairs in the sheets. Sheets smelled like pure bleach and they had rips all along the top where your head goes. TV is from the 80's with no remote.. All furniture looks like it was found on the sidewalk in the ghetto. Really .. Finish gone to bare blistered dirty wood and most of the drawer pulls gone .. busted. Big roaches on floor and walls. The bathroom has a capped pipe top to clear sewer sticking out of the floor / wall with toilet paper shoved into the hole to keep something out ???? Mold all over walls and ceiling and a ripped up moldy shower curtain. Two dirty towels and a half a roll of toilet paper. No safety lock on door. All old repairs never finished missing light bulbs Dirty seat cushions had big writing STAR INN with magic marker. Then after paying for the room they demanded five dollars for the key because I might steal it. You get your key through a bullet proof slot window. Up on shelf is their collection of porno. I am so blown away that this place in in this country. THE WORST PLACE IN THE USA STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS !!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: virginiafantasia
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very cozy and well kept clean. Management customer service was excellent and exceptionaly friendly. If there is anything you need they are willing to share their own to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The locations is very convenient to Beverly Hills, the mall, the highways, etc.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi!”
Reviews.Author: moklioki99
Reviews.Content: Despite the claims made by the manager, THERE IS NO WIFI! I have stayed in several rooms and I am positive of this. I use two different laptops, both with very strong reception, and was only lucky enough to catch a signal standing outside from across the street. Many of the rooms are dingy, the towels are all stolen from the Hyatt a few blocks away, and the management is VERY shady. Also, I have on several occasions seen the police hanging around the place. The first time there was a drug bust in one of the rooms, the other times they had called them on a tenant. I would definitely stay away from this place. The rooms are overpriced, they WILL try to charge you more for rooms that have nothing extra but a couple of chairs, and very little actually works.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: karinkSalzburg
Reviews.Content: we got to the hotel very late - around midnight..so didnt see very much because we were all really tired. around 5am in the morning we got woken up by builders who did some works on the building. no one advised us the day before that building works are going on...anyway ..we were also facing the front which is a really busy road. we basically didnt sleep once we woke up. right after breakfast we discovered a big roach in our room. ( i ve never seen anything like that before to be honest!) i went down to the front desk and asked to be moved, which they did right away. second night was much much better. bigger room, facing the back. still loud but ok. location isn't great. you definatly need a car or taxis to get somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy”
Reviews.Author: hart2008
Reviews.Content: In March 2008, I had to stay for a few days in LA for a business trip. I wanted to stay in a place close to Beverly Hills and yet would not be expensive. Searching through the internet, I found the Stars Inn. Making a reservation over the phone was easy. The rooms ranged from $60 to $90 plus tax. I chose a room with a queen size bed for $60 plus tax. The manager did not get a deposit nor my credit card information but assured me that the room would be reserved on the days I specified. Indeed, when I arrived at the motel, room 1 was reserved for me. The place was surprisingly quiet, considering it was along Santa Monica Blvd. It was only a 3 night stay but I could say it was a pleasant one. For $60 the room was fairly clean, with a refrigerator, a microwave, cable TV and wireless internet ( I paid $5 to use the internet). I was even surprised that the room had space for a small dining table. It had a small kitchen counter, too. The bed was comfortable but I could not sleep well with only 2 pillows, so upon my request, the manager gave me an extra pillow. I was delighted to see that the motel was located just across the street from an upscale mall. And I would drive just 10 minutes to my business destination in Beverly Hills . One or two rooms in the motel were being renovated when I was there but convenience was not compromised. I would be staying again at the Stars Inn when I go back to LA in December and bring my younger sister with me. The place would be ideal since I would be taking my sister to see Universal Studios Hollywood and take a tour of the city of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jyotish
Reviews.Content: Had to stay in Century City for a 3 month assignment. This hotel was the obvious first choice as it is locaed so close to all major establishments in Century City. Just a walk away from the mall. I stayed in Room 7. The room was well appointed. Has a King bed with all essential furnitures. This room has a kitched attached which was much useful. Bathroom was neat. Housekeeping was very proffessional. Most importantly this place is vey secure. For three months I stayed here, I was extremely satisfied with the security. Moreover the manager there is always available to help out on any issues. The only concern I had was that this hotel did not have an internet facility. I brought this to the notice of the manager and they made arrangements by the time I left in December. Very good. Safe.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, basic--and needs major overhaul. Would not stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: mcombs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had to attend a reception and film screening at the Century City Mall in Century City, so I did a Google search to see what hotels were close by, since we preferred something within walking distance. The Stars Inn popped up, with two flattering reviews here on TripAdvisor. So I called to make a reservation (it was a bit difficult finding their phone no.). The lady I spoke with just took my name but not my credit card number, so I was a bit perplexed about that. I told her I needed to have confirmation so she suggested I email them and they would email back a confirmation, which they did--but there was no confirmation number. She said they would hold the room until 4 p.m. and quoted me $70 for one night. When we arrived, around 1:30 p.m., before I could say anything, the man at the desk suggested we take a look in room 20, upstairs, which he said was their best room. We did a quick glance around and told him it would be fine. He said it would be $90, and when I told him I had already reserved a room for $70 and showed him a printed email copy, he then said we could take room 14 downstairs for $70, or have room 20 for $80 (plus tax, so it was $91). We decided on the upstairs corner unit since it seemed a more secure location. Well, for $91 it was NOT a good deal. It would be worth about $65. Although spacious, with working window air conditioner, ceiling fan, telephone and color TV (I had to ask him for the remote), the shower curtain was filthy, as was the cabinet under the bath sink. The ceiling of the bath was dirty and needed painting--as did the room ceiling, which had patches. The room had two armchairs, queen size bed (no blanket), old desk, dresser, end tables with lamps, microwave, refrigerator/freezer, kitchen counter, two bar stools. Two lights were out in the bathroom (no bath window curtain if you wanted to have the window open). There was no shampoo, much less a hair dryer (luckily I packed one)--and just 3 tiny bars of soap. If we hadn't had to attend an event across the street, there's no way we would have stayed here. This motel may be ok for younger people, but I was also a bit concerned about the security. The people next to us in room 19 opened and closed their doors often late at night and very early in the morning, making considerable noise. The outside doors could use some paint, too. The bath and room were clean but not THAT clean. With a bit of upgrades, the place could be so much nicer. The Century City Mall is so handy, this motel would be a great place to stay for a weekend shopping excursion. We have traveled the world, and I have to say this was one of the worst places (if not the worst) we've stayed. Especially for $91!! I plan to print this out and email it to the owners. By the way, this is the first ever hotel review I've ever written.

Reviews.Title: “Star of the Century”
Reviews.Author: LEADVOX
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Stars Inn was a pleasant surprise. This little inn is tucked away on Santa Monica Blvd. right across from the Century City Mall. I was able to walk up on a sunny Saturday afternoon and book a room for two nights at $60 dollars per night. They don't offer a weekly rate. Over the phone, I as told $50 dollars per night for a week. In person, I was told $55 dollars per night for a week. By Saturday night, the parking was full of cars, thus I assumed capacity was full at this place. I had room 17. It had double beds, TV, microwave, and air conditioning. It was a hot weekend and the air worked fine. The bathroom was a gem. The shower had wonderful tile and the bathroom sink was huge. I live in LA and the apartments I have rented for $800 dollars and up don't have bathrooms this nice. The Stars Inn is near a famous coffee establishment and Century City mall has plenty of dining and grocery establishments. If given a chance, I would gladly stay here again.

HotelInfo.Name: Stars Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 10269 Santa Monica Blvd., Los Angeles, CA 90067
